page.title: 15ALL SAINTS CHURCH LALEHAM
page.content: { All Saints Church}is Laleham School's affiliated Evangelical Church.The Church was founded in the 12th century.The pillars,arcade and west wall are built of chalk_stone and above the South Arcade are the remains of a Norman doorway.Alterations made to the church through the last 7 centuries include the south aisle and chancel which were taken down in Tudor times.The South arcade was bricked up and a red brick arch were built,the latter lasting only until the 18th century when the present chancel was built.The tower is 45 feet high and was built in 1828 and later Gothic type windows were installed.All the original roofs and doors were replaced early this century.The Chancel Chandelier was originally used in Westminister Abbey.
